channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ワーナー・ミュージック・グループのロバート・カインクルCEOと歌手のFKAツイッグスが、米上院委員会で、非合意のAIディープフェイクから人々を守る計画を支持する証言を行った（Thania Garcia/Variety）
item.description:
Thania Garcia / Variety:
Warner Music Group CEO Robert Kyncl and singer FKA twigs testify before a US Senate committee to support a plan to defend people from nonconsensual AI deepfakes  —  ‘We must enact regulation now to safeguard our authenticity and protect against misappropriation of our inalienable rights,’ FKA Twigs said.

item.title: TwitchがTikTokのようなディスカバリーフィードを展開、ライブストリームやクリップを表示するTwitch iOS/Androidアプリ内のタブとして登場（Aisha Malik/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
Twitch rolls out its TikTok-like discovery feed, launching as a tab within the Twitch iOS and Android apps showing live streams and clips  —  Twitch is officially rolling out its new TikTok-like discovery feed to all users this week, the company announced on Tuesday.

item.title: ソースパラマウントとチャーターが契約更新交渉を延長、買収交渉中のパラマウントのキャッシュフローに影響する契約は4月30日に切れる予定だった（Jennifer Maas/Variety）
item.description:
Jennifer Maas / Variety:
Source: Paramount and Charter extend contract renewal talks; the contract, which affects Paramount's cash flow amid buyout talks, was set to expire on April 30  —  Paramount Global and Charter Communications agreed to extend their talks on a deal renewal, which — for now …

item.title: アマゾン、第1四半期の広告収入は前年同期比24%増の118億ドル（予想117億ドル）、ストア事業とプライム・ビデオ事業の成長が牽引（Todd Spangler/Variety
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Amazon reports Q1 ad revenue up 24% YoY to $11.8B, vs. $11.7B est., driven by the growth of its Stores and Prime Video businesses  —  Amazon raked in $11.82 billion in advertising revenue for the first quarter of 2024, topping analyst expectations, fueled by the ecommerce giant's move …

item.title: アマゾン第1四半期：売上高は前年同期比13％増の1,433億ドル、純利益は前年同期比32億ドル増の104億ドル、営業利益は前年同期比48億ドル増の153億ドル、サブスクリプション収入は11％増の107億ドル（Annie Palmer/CNBC）
item.description:
Annie Palmer / CNBC:
Amazon Q1: revenue up 13% YoY to $143.3B, net income of $10.4B, vs. $3.2B YoY, operating income of $15.3B, vs. $4.8B YoY, subscription revenue up 11% to $10.7B  —  Amazon CEO Andy Jassy speaks at the Bloomberg Technology Summit in San Francisco on June 8, 2022.

item.title: アスレチック』誌のニュースレター購読者数は295万人で、前年比約20％増。コムスコア社によると、2024年3月の米国でのユニークビジター数は1760万人で、前年の660万人から増加した（Sara Guaglione/Digiday）。
item.description:
Sara Guaglione / Digiday:
The Athletic has ~2.95M newsletter subscribers, up nearly 20% YoY; Comscore: it had 17.6M unique visitors in the US in March 2024, up from 6.6M a year prior  —  This article was provided as an exclusive preview for Digiday+ members, who were able to access it early.

item.title: 調査結果：Peacockユーザーの33%は2023年1月に新規登録を終了しているが、2024年第1四半期も無料ティアを利用しており、Peacock Premiumユーザーの24%は毎日ストリーミングしている（Tyler Aquilina/Variety）
item.description:
Tyler Aquilina / Variety:
Survey: 33% of Peacock users were still using the free tier in Q1 2024, though new sign-ups ended in January 2023; 24% of Peacock Premium users stream it daily  —  As the ever-shifting SVOD business continues to evolve, one key challenge now confronting streamers is how to handle subscription plans that no longer exist.

item.title: アスレチック』誌がローラ・ウィリアムソンを英国・欧州担当編集長に任命、英国の日刊スポーツ誌初の女性EICとなる（ニューヨーク・タイムズ社）
item.description:
The New York Times Company:
The Athletic names Laura Williamson as its editor-in-chief for the UK and Europe, making her the first female EIC of a daily sports publication in the UK  —  Steven Ginsberg announces new leadership changes in The Athletic's U.K. newsroom, as well as growing ambitions for our London office …

item.title: The Interceptのケン・クリッペンスタインが辞任、同誌の企業化を理由に「ジャーナリズムそのものよりも資金提供者への恐れの方が重要」と発言（ケン・クリッペンスタイン）
item.description:
Ken Klippenstein:
The Intercept's Ken Klippenstein resigns, citing the outlet's corporatization and saying its “fear of funders is more important than journalism itself”  —  I resigned from The Intercept today in order to pursue a new kind of journalism here on Substack, one more hard-hitting than what's possible in the corporate world.

item.title: 情報筋GoogleはNews Corpに対し、Google News Initiativeの一環として、AI関連の新しいコンテンツや製品を開発するため、年間500万～600万ドルを支払うことで合意した（Sahil Patel/The Information）。
item.description:
Sahil Patel / The Information:
Sources: Google has agreed to pay News Corp $5M to $6M annually to develop new AI-related content and products, as part of the Google News Initiative  —  Google has agreed to pay Wall Street Journal owner News Corp between $5 million and $6 million annually to fund the news organization's development …

item.title: オールデンが所有する日刊紙8紙がOpenAIとマイクロソフトを提訴、生成AI製品のトレーニングに著作権保護された記事を無断で使用したと非難（Katie Robertson/New York Times）
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
Eight daily newspapers owned by Alden sue OpenAI and Microsoft, accusing them of using copyrighted articles without permission to train generative AI products  —  The suit, which accuses the tech companies of copyright infringement, adds to the fight over the online data used to power artificial intelligence.

item.title: ニューヨークを拠点とするニュースレター・プラットフォームbeehiivがNEA主導で3300万ドルのシリーズBを調達、調達総額は4650万ドルに達した。
item.description:
Ingrid Lunden / TechCrunch:
NYC-based newsletter platform beehiiv raised a $33M Series B led by NEA, taking its total raised to $46.5M, and says the service has ~20K active newsletters  —  With the number of people using e-mail globally approaching 5 billion, newsletters delivered regularly into people's inboxes continue …

item.title: TikTokは初のTikTok Shop Safety Reportで、2023年12月に米国で50万人以上のセラー、全世界で1500万人以上のセラーが存在し、2023年下半期には600万人以上が追加されると報告している（Alex Barinka/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Alex Barinka / Bloomberg:
In its first TikTok Shop Safety Report, TikTok reports 500K+ sellers in the US and 15M+ sellers worldwide in December 2023, adding 6M+ in H2 2023  —  - Company releases first safety report on its shopping platform  — Merchants and approved users can link products for sale

item.title: Instagramがレコメンデーションアルゴリズムを更新し、アグリゲーターアカウントを削除、オリジナルコンテンツの促進と小規模アカウントへの配信増加を狙う（Mia Sato/The Verge）
item.description:
Mia Sato / The Verge:
Instagram updates its recommendation algorithms to remove aggregator accounts, hoping to promote original content and increase distribution to smaller accounts  —  Instagram is making significant changes to how its system recommends content, with a focus on original content and increased distribution for smaller accounts.

item.title: フランスの出版グループ、ラガール社の会長兼CEOを辞任したアルノー・ラガール氏（資金流用で起訴されたため）（Sudip Kar-Gupta/Reuters
item.description:
Sudip Kar-Gupta / Reuters:
Arnaud Lagardère resigns as chair and CEO of French publishing group Lagardère SA, after an indictment accused him of misappropriating company funds  —  Arnaud Lagardere, the chairman and CEO of French publishing group Lagardere SA (LAGA.PA), has resigned from his executive roles …
